Ps_axis class

class ps_axis.ps_axis(type, N, L, M, radius, data_fname='lnw.txt', axis_loc=111)

ps_axis objects are created from the users input and pass information/specifications to the plotting scripts for a single matplotlib axis as part of a figure. Data these objects hold include the type of plot, the normal mode(s) that are to be plotted and any relevant model data, and the location of the axis on the figure.

__init__(type, N, L, M, radius, data_fname='lnw.txt', axis_loc=111)
Parameters

  • type (string) – Type of plot desired. Currently supports dispersion plots (“dispersion”), 3D volumetric animations (“3D_animated”) or 2D radial plots (“radial_2D_plot”).

  • L (1D array) – The l values for plotting - unless for a dispersion plot there should only be one element

  • M (1D array) – The m values for plotting - needed for plots of surface oscillations.

  • N (1D array) – The n values for plotting - unless for a dispersion plot there should only be one element

  • radius (float) – Radius of elastic body

  • axis_loc (int) – Axis location on MPL subplots figure, defaults to 111.

  • data_fname (string) – File name containing l, n, omega data. Defaults to lnw.txt

__weakref__

list of weak references to the object (if defined)

_assign_plottype(plot_str)

Checks inputted string is an acceptable string

Parameters

plot_str (string) – String holding desired plot_type

Raises

ValueError – if plt_str is not “dispersion”, “radial_2D_plot”, “radial_2D_surface” or “3D_animated”

_set_ps_axis_figure(f)

Allows updating of the figure attribute for this class.

Parameters

f (Matplotlib Figure object) – The matplotlib figure object
